title: A Quick Guide to Crafting Glass in Minecraft

steps.title: Fill a furnace with fuel.
steps.content: Fill a furnace with fuel. Put coal, charcoal, dried kelp, or any other fuel source into the bottom square of the furnace. Donâ€™t have a furnace? Make one by placing 8 cobblestone blocks in a ring using your crafting table.

steps.title: Place sand in the furnace.
steps.content: Place sand in the furnace. Collect sand from the shorelines around your Minecraft world and place a stack of it in the upper box of the furnace.

steps.title: Take the glass from the furnace.
steps.content: Take the glass from the furnace. The glass will appear in the results square in the smelting window.

steps.title: Place 8 glass backs surrounding a unit of dye on a crafting table.
steps.content: Place 8 glass backs surrounding a unit of dye on a crafting table. Choose the dye color that corresponds with your desired glass color and stick it in the center of the crafting table. Then, place 8 glass blocks on the outer edge of the crafting table to create a stack of 8 stained glass blocks. [1] X Research source To make each dye color, you need: Red: Beetroot, poppy, red tulip, or rosebush Orange: Orange tulip or torchflower Yellow: Dandelion or sunflower Lime: Sea pickle Green: Cactus Cyan: Pitcher plant Light blue: Blue orchid Blue: Lapis lazuli or cornflower Purple: Red and blue dye Magenta: Allium or lilac Pink: Peony, pink petals, or pink tulip Gray: Black + white dye Light gray: Azure bluet, oxeye daisy, or white tulip White: Bone meal or lily of the valley Brown: Cocoa beans Black: Ink sac or wither rose

steps.title: Place 6 glass blocks in the bottom 2 rows of a crafting table.
steps.content: Place 6 glass blocks in the bottom 2 rows of a crafting table. This gives you 16 glass panes per 6 glass blocks placed down. [2] X Research source Tip: Used stained glass blocks to make stained glass panes.

steps.title: Glass bottles
steps.content: Glass bottles Interested in brewing potions ? First, you'll need to make glass bottles. Make a "V" shape on a crafting table using 3 glass blocks. This creates 3 glass bottles. [3] X Research source To fill a bottle with water, hold it in your quick slot bar and use it on any body of water.

steps.title: Beacon
steps.content: Beacon A beacon is a special tool that can be used to boost your stats in a Minecraft battle. To make one, place 3 obsidian blocks on the bottom row of a crafting table, a nether star in the central slot, and glass blocks in all the other slots. To get a nether star: Spawn a Wither in your game and destroy it . To get obsidian: Create a system at your home base where moving water interacts with a stationary lava pool.

steps.title: Daylight sensors
steps.content: Daylight sensors Daylight sensors are redstone-based tools that analyze the amount of sunlight in the game. [4] X Research source To make one, fill your crafting table as follows: Entire top row: Glass blocks Entire middle row: Nether quartz Entire bottom row: Wooden slabs

steps.title: End crystals
steps.content: End crystals End crystals allow players to summon the ender dragon back into the game. To make an end crystal, fill your crafting table accordingly: Top row: Glass block, glass block, glass block Middle row: Glass block, Eye of Ender, glass block Bottom row: Glass block, Ghast tear, glass block
